caption: K√∂ln 75!!! Man, I‚Äôm excited about this film we made last year in Germany!!! So many incredible people came together to tell this story and support our superstar director Ido Fluk and his vision. We have been slotted for a world premiere in the Berlinale Special Gala section. K√∂ln 75 tells the true story of Vera Brandes, the teenage patron of the 1970s Cologne music scene, who organized Keith Jarrett‚Äôs legendary K√∂ln Concert. It‚Äôs all jazz, man. JAZZ!!

‚ÄúI‚Äôm both excited and humbled by this opportunity. The direction that the writers are taking with this project is important, focusing on the victims and their families as well as those who finally brought John Wayne Gacy to justice. While Gacy was the perpetrator of these horrific crimes, I‚Äôm relieved that he won‚Äôt be the main focus of the series. It‚Äôs heartbreaking for me to think of what his victims (all young men and boys) could have done with their lives had the system not failed them so tragically. I believe in the power of storytelling and hope that by telling this story, in a thoughtful way, we can play some part in preventing this from ever happening again.‚Äù

Happy 1st Birthday, June Louise. You are so much more than I ever could have imagined.
I‚Äôm so proud to be your DaDa.

Dear Emily,

Just when I thought you couldn‚Äôt be any cooler. When I figured you were just about as amazing, powerful, insightful, wise, kind, loving, smart, and badass as one person could possibly be‚Ä¶you went and got even better. More expansive. More connected. More present. More loving.

You became a Mom. But not just any Mom. June‚Äôs Mom. And it‚Äôs your finest work yet. Your greatest role. A perfect fit. You are an UNBELIEVABLE mother.

I have watched your heart grow and grow and grow. It‚Äôs been thrilling to witness.

Happy 40th Birthday. We love you so very much. Thank God you were born.

Love,
Michael (& Junie)

It was such an honor to be inducted into the beck.center Alumni Hall of Fame last night. From 1991-1995, I took drama classes at the Beck Center after school and on weekends. But it was so much more than that. During my time as a student at the Beck Center, I made lifelong friends, found a community of people (other kids like me) who I felt safe with & supported by, and I was set out on a path of artistic development that I am still on today.

Arts education for children and teens is so important. And, sadly, it is often undervalued and underfunded these days. Through studying drama and making theater at a young age I learned valuable life skills like collaboration, improvisation, creative thinking, teamwork, and self expression. My self confidence grew and my imagination expanded. But, perhaps most importantly, my empathy muscle began to grow. By inhabiting the life of a character in a play I learned how to see the world through someone else‚Äôs eyes. Walk a mile in their shoes, so to speak.

I owe a huge debt of gratitude to The Beck Center and it‚Äôs arts education programming. I simply would not be the person that I am today without Beck.

This is Beck Center‚Äôs 90th anniversary season. Last night I got to attend their annual Spotlight Gala with my parents, Dick & Barb, at gordongreenevents. It was a sweet and special evening for us. And I hope a lucrative fundraising event for beck.center! If you are looking for an arts education non-profit to support please consider making a tax deductible donation to this incredible place. It literally changed my life, as it has changed countless others.

MOLLI AND MAX IN THE FUTRE was the Opening Night Film last night at the Lower East Side Film Festival. We played to a sold out crowd at the beautiful, historic Village East Cinema (it was originally part of the former Yiddish Theatre District) which has a stunning interior with an unbelievably beautiful ceiling in the main theater.

The film is masterfully directed by the hugely talented michaellitwak with heartbreaking performances by our incredible lead actors zosiamamet and air_stotle 

This was my first night out on the town since Baby June was born (exactly 4 weeks prior to last night‚Äôs screening). Huge thanks to emsimmy and aprilpostpartum for helping facilitate Daddy taking the train down to the big city and being away from the nest for a night. Very grateful. It felt crazy and exhilarating and terrifying to be away from home and our little cocoon. 

And thanks to creemmag for my Lester Bangs t-shirt which I rocked proudly on the carpet. Thought of Lester all night, imagining him wandering the streets of Gotham and blaring ‚ÄúLet It Blurt‚Äù at cbgbofficial (and other East Village haunts) when they would let him up on stage.

Support indie films. Support small festivals that care about indie films like lesfilmfestival and others like it. Support artists and their weird beautiful brains. Most importantly support our writers and directors at every level. Without them we have no stories to tell or new worlds to explore. End of Ted Talk. Thank you.
NA

Very proud of this show and all of the amazing talent involved. Season 2 of #LittleAmerica premieres December 9 on AppleTVPlus 

Inspired by the true stories featured in Vox Media Studios‚Äô Epic Magazine, Apple TV+‚Äôs Little America is a BAFTA, Independent Spirit, NAACP Image and GLAAD Media Award-nominated series that goes beyond the headlines to look at the funny, romantic, heartfelt, inspiring and surprising stories of immigrants in America, when they‚Äôre more relevant now than ever.

Hailing from executive producers Emmy nominee Lee Eisenberg, Academy Award nominees Kumail Nanjiani and Emily V. Gordon, Academy Award winner Si√¢n Heder, Emmy Award winner Alan Yang and Epic Magazine, the second season of the series will explore eight incredible stories inspired by real people from around the world, including a Belizian woman (Stacy Rose) who works for a Hasidic family in New York, a Korean man (Ki Hong Lee) who makes hats for the Black church community in 1980s Detroit, and the story of a 40-something Japanese woman in Columbus, Ohio (Shiori Ideta)  whose dream is to assemble an all-women‚Äôs baseball league to fulfill her lifelong passion for the sport.

The complete second season will premiere with eight new installments on Friday, December 9.

It‚Äôs National Dog Day! Please consider rescuing. Both of our very good boys were rescues. It‚Äôs very fulfilling and enriching and life-changing. For both you & your doggo!

National Dog Day is celebrated August 26th annually and was founded in 2004 by¬†Animal Rescue Advocate,¬†Colleen Paige, to bring attention to the plight of animals around the globe and encourage adoption.
‚Ä®The date of August 26th is significant, as it's the date that Colleen's family adopted her first dog "Sheltie" from the local animal shelter, when Colleen was 10 years old.
‚Ä®National Dog Day celebrates all dogs, mixed breed and pure. Their mission is to help galvanize the public to recognize the number of dogs that need to be rescued each year and acknowledges family dogs and dogs that work selflessly each day to save lives, keep us safe and bring comfort.
‚Ä®National Dog Day¬†is against any kind of breed ban. "Dogs should not have to lose their lives because of the atrocities they have been forced to endure at the hands of man", says¬†Colleen Paige. ‚ÄúWhile we feel that American's have the constitutional right to purchase a pure breed dog, we strongly discourage buying dogs from pet stores supplied by puppy mills, backyard breeders, the internet and newspaper ads. Rather, we encourage those seeking new canine companions, to consider choosing adoption first. you'd like a pure breed dog, look into a pure breed rescue in your city, to see if they might have some little furry soul just waiting to make your life complete. Another great place to find a new best friend is at large chain pet stores that host adoption drives for local shelters and rescues.‚Äù

#NationalDogDay #rescuedogsofinstagram

Happy Birthday, Emily!!!!
‚Ä¢
This week has been absolute hell but there is no one else I would have wanted to go through it with.
It turns out that you are an extraordinary person to be in a foxhole with. Your ability to be both strong and vulnerable at the same time is remarkable. You hold both the dark and the light with such Grace.
‚Ä¢
Jerry had a hell of a Mom. Congratulations on crossing over into another year of life. We are all lucky to have you here.
Now he belongs to the ages.

Thank you to everyone who has been sending their love to us and Jerry. We really appreciate all the texts, calls, messages and the thoughts, prayers, & lighting of candles for our three legged wonder boy. He is at home resting right now after a harrowing day and a half. The prognosis is not good long term. The doctors discovered a mass on his heart and removed 91ml of blood from his chest. But he is a fighter (and a lover) and he won‚Äôt give up quite yet. It‚Äôs a true gift and a blessing and a miracle that the universe has granted us a little more time together. We are approaching this soberly, with open eyes. We are most likely near the end. But we prayed and wished for even just one more day with the Jer Bear and we got it today. For now, he is home. And that is truly priceless. He even went for a little walk (photo above) and still barks when he thinks someone is at the door. His tail still wags uncontrollably when his aunt/godmother sami.fego comes to pay him a visit. He still snores like an old man. We are forever grateful for the incredible care that Jerry has received from the good folks at brookfarmvetctr guardianveterinaryspecialists and newtownvets all of whom went above and beyond making sure to not only take care of Jerry but to hold and help us humans, too. Emily keeps referring to Jerry as a meteor, a comet, who was never meant to be here forever. But instead to blaze a short bright unforgettable path through our atmosphere burning an indelible and unforgettable mark in our hearts. You have taught and continue to teach us so much jerrythreelegs. You found us when we needed you most and I hope we have made you proud. Love you forever, buddy. ‚òÑÔ∏èüí´üêïüí´‚òÑÔ∏è

And here is the before picture. The old faded sign hanging on the red barn, weather beaten and battered by time.

Best. Christmas. Present. Ever. 
The old red barn on our property was once an Antiques Store. And a super faded metal sign hung on one side of the structure when we bought it, faintly advertising the long shuttered shop. It was really beat up and almost illegible. But, ever intrepid and imaginative, Emily enlisted the help of our dear friend and local artist matt_ulrich_paint to re-form and re-paint this relic. The sign was 100 percent free hand drawn and painted when originally designed. Matt lovingly and expertly breathed new life into this one of a kind piece of history. He perfectly matched the original, and almost accidental, use of different fonts. It turned out great! And we can‚Äôt wait to hang it back on the ol‚Äô red barn where it belongs. Thank you, Matt Ulrich!! You‚Äôre the best. And thank you, Emily, for the most thoughtful gift I have ever received. God Bless Us, Every One!!
BIDEN/HARRIS shirts available now over at tiedyen4biden. Help support Warnock & Ossoff and flip the Senate!

TIEDYEN4GEORGIA!!! Back in early August, we started a thing. A tie-dye shirt thing. We can‚Äôt really call it a business because it‚Äôs a complete loss from a financial perspective. But it‚Äôs been a total WIN from a pure joy and engagement and human connection and community building and and enthusiasm perspective. We raised over $128k for Biden/Harris so we basically got them elected!! Now we are turning our psychedelic grassroots powers towards the Georgia Senate runoff. If you donate $25 or more to either the raphaelwarnock or jonossoff campaigns we will send you a one of a kind, hand-made tie dye t-shirt. Absolutely free of charge as a way of showing our love to you. As you‚Äôve probably heard, we need to flip these two all important Senate seats to ensure that joebiden and kamalaharris can really get stuff done. Progressive policy change on a big level. And let‚Äôs make sure that Georgia has smart, thoughtful, compassionate leaders representing the Peach State in DC. WARNOCK/OSSOFF!!!! Oh, also our amazing ‚ÄúEvery Vote Counts‚Äù Big Peach logo was made by the incredible Georgia-based artist/designer brittdavis704.
